column4: hi, does anyone know how to activate sleep on a laptop manually (the button on the laptop isn't working) IIRC it's something like echo 1 > /sys/power/state
cat /sys/power/state
use one of those :)
cheers
heh, now to see if it actually works ;)
good luck :) Hope you have a new and proper ACPI BIOS :)
yeah, it's a dell m70.. according to hardware support on the ubuntu wiki suspend to ram should work but not to disk
ok. My wifes Dell Inspiron 6000 actually suspends very well to disk as well
my own IBM t40p does barely even survive suspend to RAM with ACPI :)  It likes APM much better :)
have you ever tried the hibernate package (+ kernel patches)?
hm, no. I have just been using APM, and since it Just Worked [tm]  I just stuck with that
fair enough
ah, it's a hackpack. I can actually suspend-to-ram without any other hacks than acpid, but maybe I could get suspend to disk to work properly with that hibernate package...
nice tips, thanks :)
bah, it sleeps without any problems but the screen doesn't come on after resuming :(
tried hitting Fn-<the key you use for switching between LCD and CRT> ?
that's a trick that is said to light up the screen on some laptops
worth a try i guess
doing a bit of googling before trying again though
yeah, all those hard resets gives bad karma :)
But I have a raid to initialize... bye now
lol, too right
